Barcode parameter list creation

barcode_params_create.Rd

barcode_params_create creates list detialing the barcode/genetic parameters for the model

barcode_params_create(
  num_loci = 24,
  ibd_length = 1,
  plaf = rep(0.5, 24),
  prob_crossover = rep(0.5, 24),
  starting_ibd = 0,
  mutation_flag = FALSE,
  mutation_rate = 1e-07
)

Arguments

num_loci

Number of loci. Default = 24
ibd_length

If we are simulating IBD dynamics, each loci is now represented by a bitset of ibd_length. Thus ibd_length needs to be long enough to ensure that as new identity relationships occur, i.e. an importation barcode will be a new identity. e.g. If your population is 1000, we may expect at 80 2400 different identities, i.e. 2^ibd_length > 2400. However, keep in mind importations as these need to be continually new, i.e. if we are simulating for 30 years, with 3 importations a day, then we will need at least length to ensure that 2^ibd_length > 2400 + (30*365*3). This will probably be automatically calculated in the future. If we are not ding IBD, then this should be 1, which is the defalt.
plaf

Vector of population level allele frequencies for the barcode. Default = rep(0.5, barcode_length)
prob_crossover

Vector of probabilities for crossover events for the barcode. Default = rep(0.5, barcode_length)
starting_ibd

Starting ibd. Default = 0
mutation_flag

Boolean for simulating mutations
mutation_rate

Probability of mutation occuring and fixing

Contents

  • Arguments
